raw_comment:
What do you notice?
I notice that many of the players are people of color, almost always over 50%, all the way up to 83%, except in Major League Baseball. But, not many coaches are people of color, always under 50% and as low as 13% in football.

What do you wonder?
I wonder how a white coach is going to be able to relate to the players when they encounter things like racism, especially in current times. I also wonder why there is such a disparity between representation of people of color in coaching positions and players. Is it because of racism and discrimination?

What impact does this have on you and your community?
This gives kids watching sports on tv the idea that people of color can’t be coaches and can only be players. This also means that there are fewer role models of people of color in coaching positions for little kids who want to do that when they grow up. This causes the kids to be discouraged and even fewer coaches will be people of color.

What’s going on in this graph? Write a catchy headline that captures the graph’s main idea.
Are Sports Teams Really That Diverse?
ace_sentences: Many players are people of color.
In most sports, the percentage of players that are people of color is more than 50 percent.
In some sports, the percentage of players that are people of color is as high as 83 percent.
In Major League Baseball, the percentage of players that are people of color is not more than 50 percent.
Not many coaches are people of color.
In all shown sports, the percentage of coaches that are people of color is less than 50 percent.
In football, the percentage of coaches that are people of color is as low as 13 percent.
I wonder how a white coach can relate to players who encounter racism.
Racism exists in current times.
I wonder why there is a disparity between the representation of people of color among coaches and the representation of people of color among players.
I wonder whether racism causes this disparity.
I wonder whether discrimination causes this disparity.
Kids watch sports on TV.
This situation gives kids the idea that people of color cannot be coaches.
This situation gives kids the idea that people of color can only be players.
There are fewer role models of people of color in coaching positions.
Some little kids want to become coaches when they grow up.
If there are fewer role models of people of color in coaching positions, then these kids can be discouraged.
If these kids are discouraged, then fewer coaches will be people of color.
The headline is: Are sports teams really that diverse?
